question: Isabella has a flower bed that is 205 feet long. Isabella wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Isabella's flowers grow 2 inches wide so she needs to leave 9.0 feet between every plant. Isabella already owns 20 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €9 at the store, how much money will Isabella spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Isabella's flower bed is 205 feet / 9 feet per plant = <<205/9=22>>22 plants needed.
Isabella needs to buy 22 plants - 20 plants = <<22-20=2>>2 plants needed to purchase.
Isabella will spend 2 plants * €9 = €<<2*9=25>>25.
#### 25
